text: Li Kwoh-ting (born January 28, 1910 â€“ died May 31, 2001) was a Taiwanese economist and politician, best known as the "father of Taiwan's economic miracle." The New York Times called him the "godfather of technology" for his work in changing Taiwan's economy from farming into one of the world's leading producers of information and telecommunications technologies. ==References== Category:1910 births Category:2001 deaths Category:Taiwanese politicians Category:Economists
title: Li Kwoh-ting
